text: Wow this is amazing, thanks so much for all the advice!! I feel a bit overwhelmed, this is so incredibly helpful and insightful. I really can't thank you enough! I'll def have a go at offsetting the timings, that was something I didn't even notice so I'm v glad you could take a look it. Something to remember for the future I think. I gave the video a play and sorry realised I hadn't exported it with sound! I'll attach another version with the (hopefully) fixed sound, and I'll offset the hands and repose them to get rid of the symmetry, would love to hear what you think. I'm not surprised to hear the CV is rarely ever looked at haha but I'm glad you've told me how to get it right. Will remove all of the drawings and just leave the layout, are the little icons ok to leave in? Oo also do you mean I should remove the little screengrabs for the two case study projects as well? Very good point on the intro, I'll chuck that out. Somehow not surprised to hear 'quadruped animation' is a buzzword hahaha so I'll put that in too, is it worth putting more quadruped shots in my showreel? (Realised my 'website' domain isn't actually active yet aha, I'm hoping to get it up and running today)

And yes I'll be updating the showreel asap (it's a bit dated aha) with the trump shot and another sequence that I've just finished today. I'll link you the new sequence so you can see it as well! Do you think the trump shot would work in a showreel? Realise now that it was a bit silly to animate someone so controversial

Otherwise I was actually hoping to begin applying for jobs in the next couple of days once the showreel is complete, and start approaching recruiters. Do you have any tips for introductions? My impression is that they prefer short conversational messages to start with (i.e. hello, how are you, I am such and such from this place, could I ask you some questions about this project / job). I was also wondering if you think I should even be thinking about applying for a job yet aha, or if I'm not at that level yet. I'm really not sure what the bar is on graduates but I thought I'd give it my best
Also sorry if I'm asking too many questions again! It's just amazing to be able to speak with someone who can answer them

I love the shots from your showreel btw! That viking from dragon rider especially, the acting was perfect. I'll def give 'here we are' a watch, the animation style is so sweet and I really like what I've seen in the trailer. Also it's amazing to me that you've worked all over the world, leaving the uk is a bit of a dream for me aha. Can I ask how you found work in so many different places?

Here's trump with the amendments and sound, is this an improvement on before? I'll give it another pass if it's not quite right yet aha. Realised again that this may not have been the best clip choice due to the profanity at the end. If I do put in the showreel, should I censor that word? Was also considering making it shorter. If you can think of any other improvements I'd really appreciate it as well! I'd like it to be the best it possibly can be
And here's the new sequence! I'm thinking of using it as the first shot, after the little introduction with contact details

Ha great Samuel, thanks for sending everything over and sorry yeah it must’ve felt a bit overwhelming no worries, I remember there is so much to learn especially in the beginning haha but all good, send and ask away and I’m sure we’ll get you a nice reel together in the next few days/week to start applying :) I’ll have a look at all of what you sent this evening/tomo morning and get back to you in detail :)

Little suggestion, do you wanna “meet up” this weekend maybe, so we’re both on the computer at the same time maybe for an hour or less and we can actually chat on slack and go through things rather than sending long paragraphs? Just if you have time of course :) Will still check out everything now of course but think for getting a reel together and making a little plan of action for you it would be easier, let me know what you think :)
